div.l: Gete vs som mete and drynke and make vs chere
And we wol paie trewely atte fulle
With empty handes men may nane haukes tulle
Lo here oure silủer redy for to spende
This meller to þe toıı̄un his doughter sende
For ale and breed / and rosted hem a goos
And bond her hors it sholde no more go loos
And in his owēn chambre he made a bed
With shetes ⁊and with chaloıı̄uns fayre yspred
Nouȝt from his owne bed ten fote or twelue
His douȝter hadde a bed al by hir selue
Right in þe same chambre by
It myghte be no bet / and cause why
Ther was no rowmer herberwe in þe place
They soupen and þei speken hem to solace
And drynken eủere strong ale atte beste
Aboute midnyght wente they to reste
Wel hath þis mellere vernysshed heed
Ful pale he was for dronken ⁊and nouȝt reed
He ȝixeth and he speketh þurgh þe nose
As he were on þe quakke or on þe pose
To bedde he goth and with hym gooth his wyf
As eny iay she light was and Iolyf
So was hir ioly whistle wel I wette
The cradel at hir beddes feet is ysette
To rokken and to ȝeue þe childe to souke
And whan þᵗat dronken was al in crouke
To bedde wente þe douȝt̉er right anoon
To bedde gooth Aleyn and also Iohn
TherTheTher was no more hem neded no dwale
The mellere hath so wisely bibbed ale
That as an hors he snorteth in his sleep
Ne of his tayl ende ne taketh he no keep
His wyf bar hym a burdoıı̄un a ful strong
Men myghte hẻre routyng here a forlong
The wenche routeth eke ꝑpar companye
Aleyn þe clerk þat herde þis melodye
He powked Iohn and seide slepistow
Herd þᵘou eủere slyk a sang as now
